item.title: Additem (not in pvp)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:18, topic:537057”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=655873.msg4389999#msg4389999 date=1387128923]
Gooby pls, Notepad++ is for quick fixes.
[/quote]
What do you mean it’s for quick fixes? I usually code using notepad solely for things like rsps, gui’s etc.

Why would you make mistakes in the first place?[/quote]
Everybody makes mistakes.
Notepad++ doesn’t promote proper conventions, let alone point out errors before they happen. I use notepad++ for html mostly, since I cbf to open Dreamweaver (I also don’t like WYSIWYG editors). And when I say quick fixes lets say you accidentally gave someone power to use a command, and you don’t want them using that command. Open N++ and quickly fix that then compile and so on.

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:19, topic:537057”]if(something) return else doSomething
is the same as

if(something) return
doSomething

If I’m mistaken then please provide a counterexample. Secondly, I said that you’re spreading bullshit because you quoted me saying that the return is fine even after I explained why it’s wrong. It doesn’t matter if you didn’t write it… this is reinforcement of incorrect advice.[/quote]
For the first part, you’re correct but at the same time, incorrect (in this case only). Since OP wants to make sure the attack time is less than or equal to 0 as well as check if the player is not in the wild.

As for the second statement. I said the return should be fine. Not that it is.

Read full topic

item.title: Additem (not in pvp)
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

if(something) return else doSomething
is the same as

if(something) return
doSomething

If I’m mistaken then please provide a counterexample. Secondly, I said that you’re spreading bullshit because you quoted me saying that the return is fine even after I explained why it’s wrong. It doesn’t matter if you didn’t write it… this is reinforcement of incorrect advice.

Read full topic

item.title: Additem (not in pvp)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:16, topic:537057”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=655873.msg4390015#msg4390015 date=1387131315]

Just a point - you should probably have added a brace like I originally suggested instead of adding the return statement. It might be fine in your example, but I can’t see the code around the switch block so don’t know if it’s ok to just return out of the entire method? Even if this is ok, I still think it’s bad style because you or someone else might add something at the end of that method and not realise there’s a hidden return in there.

The return should be fine, in this case, because if the player is in the wild, it returns. The switch block is in ClickingButtons.java, and the only thing that class does is, well, handle button clicks.

@OP. Try putting a else in front of the if after the return.
[/quote]You seem to have a habit of giving out completely incorrect code advice. Are you being malicious or do you just believe your own bullshit?[/quote]
Explain to me how telling him to put a else in front of an if is incorrect? I didn’t tell him to put the return there, so don’t even think that was my doing.

Read full topic

item.title: Additem (not in pvp)
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:15, topic:537057”][quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=655873.msg4390002#msg4390002 date=1387129391]
Just a point - you should probably have added a brace like I originally suggested instead of adding the return statement. It might be fine in your example, but I can’t see the code around the switch block so don’t know if it’s ok to just return out of the entire method? Even if this is ok, I still think it’s bad style because you or someone else might add something at the end of that method and not realise there’s a hidden return in there.
[/quote]
The return should be fine, in this case, because if the player is in the wild, it returns. The switch block is in ClickingButtons.java, and the only thing that class does is, well, handle button clicks.

@OP. Try putting a else in front of the if after the return.[/quote]You seem to have a habit of giving out completely incorrect code advice. Are you being malicious or do you just believe your own bullshit?

Read full topic

item.title: Additem (not in pvp)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

xx matty xx:

Just a point - you should probably have added a brace like I originally suggested instead of adding the return statement. It might be fine in your example, but I can’t see the code around the switch block so don’t know if it’s ok to just return out of the entire method? Even if this is ok, I still think it’s bad style because you or someone else might add something at the end of that method and not realise there’s a hidden return in there.

The return should be fine, in this case, because if the player is in the wild, it returns. The switch block is in ClickingButtons.java, and the only thing that class does is, well, handle button clicks.

@OP. Try putting a else in front of the if after the return.

    ^

                    if(c.attackTimer <= 0) {
                    ^

src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:1034: unreachable statemen
t

item.title: Additem (not in pvp)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

^He just fixed it for you. You had 2 opening and one closing.
Tip: When using an if/else statement and you only want it to do 1 thing, ignore adding brackets. Example:

if(c.playerRights > 2)//See, there's no opening bracket here. return; else{//But there is one here since you do 2 things. c.sendMessage("You're not staff"); return; }

Read full topic

item.title: Additem (not in pvp)
item.dc:creator: @cammyPVPftw cammyPVPftw
item.description:
@cammyPVPftw wrote:

Basically i made clickable spawn gear in quest tab, and i am getting an error with this code. i dont want items to be spawned in wild.

[code=java]case 28171: // food
if (!c.inWild()) {
if (c.attackTimer <= 0) {

		c.getItems().addItem(392,1000);
		c.getItems().addItem(15272,27);
		c.sendMessage("You successfully spawned some food.");
		}
		break;[/code]

Read full topic
